intro: Inversodicraea torrei, commonly known as the Torre's inversodicraea, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and small trees. The plant is characterized by its evergreen foliage and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments at high altitudes. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
